summary: Diff adds a React canvas-based 2D shooter with start/pause/game-over screens, HUD, React Query-powered leaderboard UI, and Motoko leaderboard APIs. However, backend persistence via stable storage is not implemented, and leaderboard display lacks the requested username/profile-name fallback behavior. Generated image asset files under public/ are not evidenced in the diff summary. There is also unrequested footer/branding content and emoji usage.

missing_requirements.requirement: Use stable storage so leaderboard scores persist across canister upgrades (stable variables).
missing_requirements.reason: backend/main.mo defines `let scores = Map.empty<Principal, Nat>();` which is not a stable variable and no preupgrade/postupgrade or stable structure is shown, so persistence across upgrades is not evidenced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Frontend leaderboard should show username fallback as the principal text if no profile name is available.
missing_requirements.reason: Leaderboard rows render a truncated principal string only (`slice(0, 20)}...`) and there is no profile/username lookup or fallback logic shown beyond principal text itself.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add generated static image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (player, enemy, bullet, background).
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend code references the expected paths, but the diff summary does not show the actual image files being added under `frontend/public/assets/generated` (binary/static assets may be omitted, but no evidence is provided here).

hallucinated_features.description: Added a fixed footer with “Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai” external link and branding.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request any footer/attribution branding, and user-facing UI text must be English (it is) but the heart emoji/branding is not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend rejects submitting a score of 0 or less (`if (score <= 0) { return }`).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest/AC only requires not lowering an existing best score; it does not specify filtering out 0 scores.
